metadata.title: Friday, 18th July, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of Mununga and Nabwalya Secondary Schools in Mfuwe Parliamentary Constituency will commence; and
(b)    when the Government will send teachers to all the community schools in the Constituency.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education when construction of science laboratories at the following Secondary Schools in Kazungula District will commence
parts: (a)    Musokotwane;
(b)    Nyawa;
(c)    Simango; and
(d)    Mukuni.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs when police posts will be constructed at the following locations in the North-Western Province to enhance security
parts: (a)    Mumbeji, along the M8 Road; and
(b)    Kayombo.

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    what the financial status of Zambia Railways Limited was as of April, 2014;
(b)    how much profit the Company made in 2013; and
(c)    what the future plans of the Company, in terms of recapitalisation, are.

questions.minister: Minister of Home Affairs whether the
questions.question_text: Government has any plans to limit the number of churches in the country.

parts: (a)    what species of fish are found in Western Province, particularly in the Zambezi and Lwanginga Rivers and surrounding lakes;

questions.minister: Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication
parts: (a)    when the Government will ban the movement of heavy trucks and buses at night; and
(b)    what immediate measures the Government has taken to reduce road traffic accidents.

questions.minister: Minister of Justice when the following Local Courts in Mwinilunga Parliamentary Constituency will be rehabilitated
parts: (a)    Kakoma;
(b)    Sailunga; and
(c)    Kanongesha.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of Chikenge Secondary School in Chief Kalunga’s area in Kabompo District will commence; and
(b)    when construction of three Colleges of Excellency in Mathematics and Science in the following Provinces will commence:
(i)    Eastern; (ii)    North-Western; and (iii)    Western. QUESTION FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W33    Mr Mbulakulima (Chembe) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication:
(a)    what the progress on the Link Zambia 8000 Road Project was in relation to the following as of April, 2014:
(i)    total kilometres covered; (ii)    expenditure; and (iii)    meeting priorities set out in Phases I and II; and
(b)    why the following roads have not been worked on in accordance with priorities in Phases I and II:
(i)    Chembe-Milenge; (ii)    Itezhi-tezhi-Mumbwa; (iii)    Kawambwa-Mushota-Luwingu; (iv)    Kashikishi-Chiengi-Kaputa; and

(v)    Musaila-Lubwe-Kasaba-Luwingu. NOTICE OF MOTION AND ORDER OF THE DAY Mr Mwale Report of the Public Accounts Committee:  That this House do adopt the Report of the Public Accounts Committee on the Report of the Auditor-General on the Accounts of the Republic for the Financial Year Ended 31st December, 2012, for the Third Session of the Eleventh National Assembly, laid on the Table of the House on 16th July, 2014. 1    The Zambia Chartered Institute of Logistics and Transport Bill    (N.A.B. 1/2014) Report Stage
